page.title: 07The Anstruther Lifeboat
page.content: The lifeboat"The Doctors",an "Oakley" type, self-righting 37ft boat has been in service since 1965 as the 6th boat in 120 years. 62 launches saving 24 lives have been made but only 1 rescue has been made this year. A new boat is expected as a shed boat usually lasts 25 years. Last winter the lifeboat's refit involved a hard cover cockpit & VHF direction-finding equipment. 7 men +2 back-up and 6 launchers make up the crew.The mechanic is the only fulltime employee. A crew member receives Â£29 a year + Â£4 for every exercise. This is not a lot for risking your life! The boat covers an area from the Forth Bridges to the North Sea. The annual Lifeboat Gala will be held on July 20th.There will be a raft race stalls, parades and a helicopter from Leuchars. We hope a lot of money will be raised.
